dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARK ZUCKERBERG is a sweet looking 19 year old whose lack any physically intimidating attributes masks a very complicated and dangerous anger. He has trouble making ey contact- and sometimes it's hard to tell if he's talking or to himself. ERICA, also 19, is Mark's date. She has a girl-next-door that makes her easy to fall for. At this point in the conversation she already knows that she'd rather not be t and her politeness is about to be tested. The scene is stark and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you distinguish yourself in a population of people who all got 1600 on their SAT's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know they take SAT's in China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't talking about China anymore, I was talking about here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got 1600?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can sing in an a Capella group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean that you actually got nothing wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you row crew or you invent a 25 dollar PC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you get into a final club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you get into a final club, exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like guys who row crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I can't do that. And yes, it means I got nothing wrong on the test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever tried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To row crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get into a final club. To row crew? No. Are you, like--whatever--crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes, Mark-seriously-YOU say two things at once and I'm not sure which one we're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've seen guys who row crew, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well.. they're bigger than me. They're world class athletes. And a second ago you said you like guys who row crew so I assumed you'd met one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I meant I liked the idea of it. The way a girl likes cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Phoenix is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a new topic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same topic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still talking about the finals clubs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather talk about something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that since the beginning of the conversation about finals clubs I think I may have had a birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can change the subject. ERICA. (can't get over it) There are more people in China with genius IQ's than the entire population of--

dialogues.text: It's about exclusivity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .....what is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final clubs. And that's how you distinguish yourself. The Phoenix is the most diverse. The Fly Club, Roosevelt punched the Porc.

dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porcellian, the Porc, it's the best of the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually meant which Roosevelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, which is the easiest one to get into? MARK takes a cigarette from a pack, lights it, takes a dr and blows the smoke out before he says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: why would you ask me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all hard to get into. My friend Eduardo made $300,000 betting on oil futures last summer and he won't get in. Money or the ability to make it doesn't impress anybody around here. Everybody can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made $300,000 in a summer?

dialogues.text: He likes meteorology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it was oil futures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can predict the weather you can predict the price of heating oil. You asked me that because you think the final club that's easiest to get into is the one where I'll have the best chance,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost my place again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was honestly just asking. Okay? I was asking just to ask. Mark, I'm not speaking in code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be straight forward and tell you that I think you should be a lot more supportive. If I get in I'll be taking you to the parties and you'll be meeting people that you wouldn't normally get to meet.

dialogues.text: Yes sir, and the R.A. made a recommendation to the Ad Board but the Ad Board won't hear us. SUMMERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried dealing with Mr. Zuck.e.rberg directly? CAMERON

dialogues.text: You chased him? CAMERON (BEAT)

dialogues.text: I saw him and I know he saw me and I started after him and he disappeared SUMMERS

SUMMERS

dialogues.text: I'm devastated by that. CAMERON

dialogues.text: What my brother means is that if Mark Zuckerberg walked into our dorm room and stole our computer it would be a university issue, right? SUMMERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colleagues of their father. SUMMERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you see? TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a petty larceny. CAMERON (CALMING) TY-- TYLER

dialogues.text: This idea is potentially worth millions of dollars. SUMMERS

dialogues.text: Millions of dollars? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SUMMERS

dialogues.text: You might be letting your imagination run away with you. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

SUMMERS

dialogues.text: Well. I would try letting your- imaginations run away with you on a new project. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would. SUMMERS

dialogues.text: Everyone at Harvard is inventing something or starting a new business in their dorm room- Harvard undergraduates believe that inventing a job is better than getting one so can I suggest again that the two of you come up with a new new project? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but that-'s not the point, sir. SUMMERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be an intellectual property expert to understand-the, difference between right and wrong. SUMMERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're saying that I don't? CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm not saying that. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just start another project? Like we're making a diorama for the science fair? SUMMERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And if you have a goddam problem with that, Mr. Winklevoss, the courts are always at your disposal. Athletes don't get special treatment at this school. TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they get fairness? SUMMERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't get to run to daddy. Okay? This isn't 50 years ago.
TYLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both. Is there anything else I can do for you? TYLER-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I wouldn't mind that much if you took a flying-- CAMERON (STOPPING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ty. (BEAT)

dialogues.text: Thank you for your time, sir. We appreciate your seeing us. SUMMERS
